author: Anonymous Poet
title: 6b: Mutual Reference / Backtracking Search Pt. 3
question:
Hi, it's from the edx video Backtracking Search Pt. 3
I have a question about adding a parameter (n)

As far as i know when you add a new parameter to the function template

n goes behind every (…) + recursive call

so, shouldnt it be like this?

(define (find–element n e)
  (… n (elt-name e)    ;String
       (elt-data e)    ;Integer
       (find–loe n (elt-subs e))))

(define (find–loe n loe)
  (cond [(empty? loe) (… n)]
        [else
         (… n (find–element ... n (first loe))
              (find–loe ... n (rest loe)))]))
below this is the picture from video, i dont understand why he doesnt put (n) after ...
instructor_answer: We are a little more careful about adding the n after all the ... now that we used to be.  We used to just remember "oh I also have n if I want it".  But now we put it in explicitly as a reminder.
